description: I jhave some problems when trying to edit the entries, in the begining, better use the version for the OS
The application is Java based and if you are a user who has flip between Windows and Linux often, this is the app for you.
still to buggy. adding a new entry sometimes doesn't work properly. had to go to the stable old version

WARNING: the current (Oct. 21, 2019) snap version of this software is horribly buggy, but the dev build at https://builds.jabref.org/master/ is fine. I hope this gets fixed soon!

The genius of JabRef is that, in the end, you are just editing a big .bib file. The benefit of this is that when you fix problems with a ref, you fix them _for good_, unlike in, e.g., Zotero, where every time you export a bibliography to .bib, problems can arise.
summary: Best reference manager if you use latex

description: Yet again JabRef has gone from happily connecting to libreoffice to refusing to do so. I'm guessing a java update has caused issues, but I've had enough of wasting my time trying to coach this piece of referencing software to communicate with my thesis. It might take me half a day to switch to another referencing program, but that's better time spent than trying to cox this one back to life again.
summary: Intermittent issues make it totally unreliable

description: The interface is good and handy, but it gives me an unhandled exception when I am trying to search something on IEEEXpore, which makes it useless in my case.

jkldsfa!

skdlfja
Nice to have this version here and don't have to install it manually!
summary: Buggy, but don't want to miss it

description: very good application for database of citation!!!!11
gbhtrhrthtrhrthr thrthrthrth

I have used Mendely, Jabref and Zotero. Jabref has an additional advantage of exporting all and selected citation in CSV format and generate a citation from plain text. Of course each software has its own advantages and disadvantages. Many times I need to use both mendeley as well as Jabref

This app changed the way how I manage my papers and books.
And before the snap it was problematic to set it up on ubuntu.
But with this snap everything seems to work just fine.
Thanks a lot!
Great for sorting papers etc and adding your own commentss, groups, keywords, marking as read,... 4 stars because my groups where deleted after I opened a .bib file in an older jabref version.
The current version eats up all my RAM when I open it. Still a great tool, but - as others have already said - buggy.
This is really such a great reference manager. I'm coming to it from Mendeley, and I like it better, actually. Working great on KDE from the Snap.
Jabref is a simple but useful software to work with reference for Latex
powerful tool, i like it, work well with TexStudio
I can't use EndNote because it does not work on Linux, Mendeley is getting messier and messier, this is exactly what I was looking for. Thanks!
Not sure whats wrong. When tried installing it on Ubuntu studio 20.4 LTS. It says it is not supported! Quite strange. Anyone to help?

to install deb package (Jan 29 2021):
Download and SAVE .deb file from https://www.jabref.org/#downloads
open filebrowser and right click on .deb package, choose software install, this takes a bit, then coose --> install

it works quite well
it does not tell you if there is a mistake in database that you are loading. It simly does not load the file and you have to find the mistake by yourself

I work in computer science as a researcher and looked at quite a few options to manage my references, including short summaries of papers, chapters etc.
As I'm using LaTeX for virtually everything, I needed something that would interact nicely with Bib(La)TeX - and Jabref is the best reference manager I've come across.
summary: Best BibTeX reference manager I've used

description: If you use LaTeX and/or files .bib (BibTeX) to deal with reference management, so It's the best alternative for you. Even though you don't use LaTeX, I prefer JabRef over any other Reference Manager (EndNote, Zotero, Mendeley, etc) to create a digital library.
summary: Best Reference Manager for Linux users

description: Perfect. However, the Snap version seems to have a problem. The .deb from the website works fine.
This cr@p is written in Java. This is all I have to say. Buggy, slow, unusable.
summary: Written in Java = Is a Cr@p

description: Just sync your library with Drive and you are good to go.
summary: the best reference manager I've used

description: Always a charm to work with. Cross platform and amooth - just all good for LaTeX and BibTex use.
Managing references at its best. I recommend using the deb version. Perfomance issues are solved in 5.1!
Great and easy to use tool for managing ones bibliography.
summary: Updated Review: Bugs have been fixed! Great Tool!

description: Great UI, great functionality. The go to software when you are doing research. Thank you, developers.
Einfaches und gut strukturiertes Tool. Läuft bei mir auch super unter Ubuntu 18.04
Very usefull application. A fundamental tool for organizing references in a thesis.
The best option to replace the paid reference manager softwares

au travail, idéal pour la biblio 

à la maison, très bien aussi pour organiser d'autres fichiers. 
pour ma part, c'est pour les fichiers de musique: 
partitions pdf, tablature au format guiar pro, backing track au format mp3, tutoriels de guitare au format mp4...

On peut paramétrer les applications qui ouvrent ensuite chaque type de fichier... super pratique!
summary: génial au travail (biblio) et à la maison (ex. musique)
